required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this post approval study of heart block is to gather additional information regarding how often patients develop heart block (atrioventricular block) after having standard ablation procedure using cryotherapy with the Freezor™ catheter.

detailed_description.textblock: Due to the lack of enrollments for the trial. The FDA and Medtronic discussed the inclusion of data found from from published literature (external studies) to corroborate study endpoint. The FDA allowed this data and the study was closed.

primary_outcome.measure: Device or Procedure Related AV Block Persistent Through Discharge From Hospital.

secondary_outcome.measure: AV Block That Requires the Insertion of a Permanent Pacemaker: Defined as the Insertion of a Permanent Pacemaker, as Assessed During Defined Study Follow up.

arm_group.description: Subjects with Atrio Ventricular Reentrant Tachycardia (AVNRT)will be treated with cryo (freezing) energy to ablate the slow pathway causing the arrythmia.
This arm was taken from pier reviewed published reports that include adult subjects ablated with the Freezor catheter for AVNRT.

intervention.intervention_name: Freezor® Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter CryoConsole System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Some inclusion criteria can only be established during the electrophysiologic study (EPS); thus there are two groups of inclusion criteria.
For inclusion in the study subjects must fulfill ALL of the following criteria:
Pre-EPS inclusion criteria:
1. Patients with a clinical history of AVNRT who are referred for ablation.
2. Patients willing to provide written informed consent.
Post-EPS inclusion criteria:
1. Patients with EPS-documented AVNRT
Exclusion Criteria:
ANY of the following is regarded as a criterion for excluding a subject from the study:
1. Patients with any pre-existing AV block.
2. Patients with known cryoglobulinemia

facility.name: Columbia University Medical Center and the New York Presbyterian Hospital

reference.citation: Friedman PL, Dubuc M, Green MS, Jackman WM, Keane DT, Marinchak RA, Nazari J, Packer DL, Skanes A, Steinberg JS, Stevenson WG, Tchou PJ, Wilber DJ, Worley SJ. Catheter cryoablation of supraventricular tachycardia: results of the multicenter prospective "frosty" trial. Heart Rhythm. 2004 Jul;1(2):129-38.

group.title: Focal Cryoablation Group
group.description: Subjects with Atrio Ventricular Reentrant Tachycardia (AVNRT)will be treated with cryo (freezing) energy to ablate the slow pathway causing the arrythmia. Freezor® Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter CryoConsole System: cryoablation

group.title: External Data Supporting the Study
group.description: Data from published reports that include subjects that met inclusion criteria for study and contained data of Heart block.

participants_list.participants: Date of Post- Approval Study protocol approval

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Subjects were exited at EP study

baseline.population: A total of 105 subjects gave actual consent in the study. Of the 105 consented 75 went on to have an ablation procedure performed. Data from 675 subjects were taken from published data that met inclusion criteria with publication search approved by the FDA.

group.title: Focal Cryoablation Group
group.description: Subjects with Atrio Ventricular Reentrant Tachycardia (AVNRT)will be treated with cryo (freezing) energy to ablate the slow pathway causing the arrythmia. Freezor® Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter CryoConsole System: cryoablation

group.title: Subjects Consented in the Study Not Ablated
group.description: Actual Subjects that were consented in the study that did not meet inclusion criteria.

group.title: Subjects Collected From Published Data
group.description: Published evidence about the safety and efficacy of using Medtronic’s Freezor® 4 mm CryoCatheter has been reported since the initiation of the CryoFACTS-PAS. The results reported in the literature provide the supplemental data in the same study population as in the PAS and are included to meet the study objectives, as agreed upon with the FDA.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Slow enrollment in the trial showed limited the amount of available data. Detailed subject data from the published literature was not available.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Adam Cline, MD, MSc.- Sr. Clinical Research Specialist
